paper_abstract: Brlek and Reutenauer conjectured that any infinite word u with language closed under reversal satisfies the equality 2D(u) = Sigma(+infinity)(n=0) T-u(n) in which D(u) denotes the defect of u and T-u(n) denotes C-u(n + 1) - C-u(n) + 2 - P-u(n + 1) - P-u(n), where C-u and P-u are the factor and palindromic complexity of u, respectively. BrIek and Reutenauer verified their conjecture for periodic infinite words. Using their result, we prove the conjecture for uniformly recurrent words. Moreover, we summarize results and some open problems related to defects, which may be useful for the proof of the Brlek-Reutenauer conjecture in full generality. (C) 2011 Elsevier B.V.
